abstract: Arizona health officials are tracking thousands of people, including some 195 children, as it seeks to contain potential measles outbreak ahead of Super Bowl in Phoenix area; authorities have asked those without vaccinations to remain at home for 21 days to avoid infection; outbreak began in Southern California at Disneyland, and has produced 7 confirmed cases in Arizona so far.
lead_paragraph: State health officials are tracking hundreds of people, including at least 195 children, who might have been exposed in an outbreak that began at Disneyland.
snippet: State health officials are tracking hundreds of people, including at least 195 children, who might have been exposed in an outbreak that began at Disneyland.

headline.main: More Than 1,000 in Arizona Are Watched for Measles
headline.print_headline: Over 1,000 in Arizona Are Watched for Measles
